summary: The Export-Import Bank helps finance U.S. companies' exports. According to its policy, the Bank generally cannot finance defense goods and services unless they are nonlethal and primarily used for civilian rather than military purposes (i.e., dual use). The Bank monitors these dual-use exports to ensure that they are used mostly for civilian purposes, and we report annually on the Bank's monitoring. As in past years...
title: Export-Import Bank: Status of End-Use Monitoring of Dual-Use Exports as of August 2018
